alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 2:01PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Twiggs, Monroe, Jones and Bibb Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Oconee, Oglethorpe and Greene Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Milledgeville affecting Baldwin, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Johnson, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. The dirt parking lot by the Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp is under one to three feet of water. The end of Old Balls Ferry Road begins to flood. Flooding continues and spreads further into the woodlands near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM EST Thursday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.6 feet on 09/20/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM EST.
